result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 8:52 a.m.
Intern Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Samantha A Sporer in court. 
Court sets the case for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:32 AM Defendant Samantha A Sporer in court.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests to waive her right to counsel.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  State requests 90 days for defendant to complete requests pursuant to offer.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Defendant
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:53 AM Defendant Samantha A Sporer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant presents statements as to her non appearance at prior court date.
Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant will proceed without counsel.
The Defendant is given the waiver or right to attorney paperwork in court.
The Defendant is to fill out that paperwork in its entirety before the next court date.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Samantha A Sporer not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State is asking for an adjournment.  The Court will set this matter back over for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:35 PM Defendant Samantha A Sporer not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court received a letter from the defendant today indicating that she is a new employee and was unable to request permission to leave.  The State does not object to an adjournment and the Court staying a capias.  The Court will set this matter over for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Request to adjourn court date.
Hearing on April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Order Appointing Counsel denied, signed by Commissioner David Herring on April 5, 2022.

records.addlTxt: 02:32 PM Defendant Samantha A Sporer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court takes recess at 2:35 pm so the defendant may fill out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Case recalled at 2:51 pm with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Defendant sworn. Court denies request.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:46 PM Defendant Samantha A Sporer in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
